content: Also consider the Save the Last Dance in 2001, in which Bianca Lawson’s character Nikki says to Julia Stiles’s character after beating her ass: “The whole world ain’t enough; you gotta conquer ours too.” Given that Stiles is the perceived heroine in this story, the altercation is designed to garner sympathy for the poor vilified white girl who is merely a victim of her skin color, as well as Black Girl Aggression. (Extreme sarcasm font.)
